intro: Cacalia acuminata, commonly known as the sharpleaf cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and pointed, giving it its common name, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Cacalia acuminata is often found in regions with well-drained soils and full sunlight.
